result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cynthia Annette Pecore

records.addlTxt:
10:46 AM Defendant Cynthia Annette Pecore in court, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Cynthia Annette Pecore.  Attorney Amy Pautzke in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews Information as to Ct. 1 w/repeater and Deft. enters a NO CONTEST plea.  Plea question & waiver of rights reviewed.  Voting/Firearms.  Court finds waiver made freely & voluntarily and accepts plea and Deft. is adjudged guilty.  Orders a JOC entered into the record.  PSI ordered.  Present bond cont'd.  22TR594 and 22TR593 dismissed.
